alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:37PM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow creating reduced visibilities down to less than one mile at times. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. North-northwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact travel. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps
